line=784 tag=L:  (44)    Minä e-n     epäily-tä    hän-tä.
line=785 tag=G:          I(N) NEG- 1S suspect- CAUS him/her- P
line=786 tag=B:  12
line=787 tag=M:    Several authors (Heinämäki 1984, Vainikka 1989) associate this phenomenon with the aspectual role of
line=788 tag=M:  the partitive to signal that the event is [-BOUNDED] or [-COMPLETED].
line=789 tag=B:
line=790 tag=B:
line=791 tag=B:
line=792 tag=B:                                                  158
line=793 tag=B:
line=794 tag=B:                                                                                               Nelson
line=795 tag=B:
line=796 tag=B:
line=797 tag=B:
line=798 tag=T:           `I don't make him/her suspicious'

line=1144 tag=B:
line=1145 tag=M:  to be a very special kind of vocative because unlike ordinary vocatives they can be first person,
line=1146 tag=M:  and take the clitic -kin `also'.
